Description: Foot and body sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery pyxis (?) with flat base; interior and exterior black; groove at junction with foot reserved; underside reserved, with worn traces of incised inscription.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hellenion (Naukratis), In the area around Site 19 (Hogarth), the 'Aphrodite shrine' [Hogarth et al. 1898-9, 66]
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
1912.40 written on sherd; ‘T’ added to record to distinguish it from the other 1912.40 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1973)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
